name: Econo Lodge at the Falls

reviews.title: Worst ever in my 11 years of travel
reviews.text: We had to stay at this place on labor-day long week end. First of all it was a rip-off about - $260/room (TimeSqure is a possibility with that kind of money). The unspeakably unprofessional (and uncivilized) staff was very rude and was treating guests as if they were doing a favor lending rooms to them. When asked about a refrigerator that their web site promised, and was a necessity with kids, the owner insisted I pay extra for this and hung up on me when I was persistent. When confronted at front desk, he threatened me with eviction. He backed off when after threatening to call the cops myself. I saw half-a-dozen guests with family and children fighting with the guy through out the afternoon regarding issues with parking to reservation to stinking rooms.

reviews.title: Clean/ Needs a Makeover
reviews.text: The place is filthy and even the cloths smells of Indian spices.

reviews.title: Worst Hotel Stay ever
reviews.text: Please… please stay away from this Hotel. Go to Canadian side or even consider staying outside the city and drive in for site-seeing.

reviews.title: Hated it...never lived in a hellish place before
reviews.text: The employees were very nice, the room was clean, the balcony was great to watch the fireworks over the falls, but I think they are attempting to remodel and if not they really should. The carpet was not so nice, the paint splatter was not nice to look at, but overall for the prices I would consider staying there again. If I wasnt on a budget next time, I would stay somewhere else. But, this hotel is in walking distance from all of the attractions which was a plus.

reviews.title: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life!!!!
reviews.text: Hotel stay was awful, hotel was dirty and very old. The staff treated us like crap and was very rude. The man screamed at my mom across the parking lot and called her a racist. He was just trying to cover up the way he treated us by making up something. We have never been treated that bad at a hotel ever. I would not reccommend this place to anyone. I reccommend the canadian side, they have alot higher value on service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location walking distance to Niagra Falls.
reviews.title: Good location - but...

reviews.text: The room was OK nothing special and had obviously been smoked in. The reception and hallways had a nasty smell about them - unsure what! Very noisy so dont expect a lot of sleep. We were awake at 5.30AM
reviews.title: Worst place

reviews.text: Good coninental breakfast provided cereal, toast, coffee, Juice and muffins.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Other than a very very slow and unwelcoming curry house next door you will end up eating at the Hard Rock cafe close by.
reviews.title: Rip off! Avoid if you can! Be aware of double charging!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the 10th of May. It is a place is frequented only by Indians. Anybody else will find it uncomfortable. The entire place is dirty. It smells and has tiny cokroaches in the corners. The worst part is that the beds are filled with bugs, hundreds of them emerge once the lights are turned out. We kept the lights on all night and despite that my son woke up screaming as a huge spider was climbing on him.
reviews.title: Yuck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Econo Lodge as a last minute trip to Niagara Falls.The name says it all "ECONOmy"Lodge. This is where u stay when your not looking to spend too much money. i dont know what people expect to see but it was fine to us considering the amount we payed. We expected worse believe it or not. But the place was VERY clean and the staff was very professional(2005). Electronic locks on the door, cable tv, clean bathroom, very roomy, we even had a balcony. There are only 3 things that i felt normal people might not like about the lodge...1st is the Continental breakfast. mini muffins, and milk. 2nd we stayed at the lodge in the summer. And on the balcony there is a light that we were unable to turn off so it attracted ALOT of bugs....so what we did was take a shoebox and coverd the light and ...i know this is gonna sound a bit extreme ...lol... but i took my wifes hairspray and a lighter and torched the bugs out of there. Didnt have no problems after that cause the light was blocked. But now that u are reading this review i will save u time and tell u to just buy OFF deck and patio. 3rd the lodge is on the new york side...all the attractions of niagara falls are on the canadian side. its about 3 miles away so its alot of walking. i would recommend STAYING ON THE CANADIAN SIDE! PLEASE TRUST ME.
reviews.title: WHAT WOULD U EXPECT? ECONO LODGE IS FINE

likes.disliked: — THE BUGS ON THE BALCONY AND DISTANCE FROM THE ATTRACTIONS

reviews.text: YOU DONT NEED A PASSPORT TO "WALK" OR "DRIVE" OVER THE BORDER (untill jan of 2008). you only need one if you are flying over. Just bring valid drivers license and ONLY IF YOU HAVE IT a birth certificate. My wife went to niagara falls again last month with some friends who didnt have a passport so what they did was took a plane to buffalo int airport rented a car and drove(20 mins) over the border.
reviews.title: BAD is not bad enough to describe it

likes.disliked: — Just overall problems encountered, and the way they were handled by staff

reviews.title: Worst place to stay
reviews.text: Booked the reservation through Choicehotels.com. Because I intended to use choice stamps (part of Choice Hotels "loyalty" program) for one of my nights on this stay, I subsequently called the Choice reservation number to find out what I had to do to use the stamps. I was told to just present them at check-in for a $50 credit towards the room rate that I had booked on-line. When I went to check -in for the stay, the desk clerk told me they couldn't honor the stamps because "it was not showing up in the computer reservation that I was intending to use them." I also was told that they were no longer giving out stamps for stays either, and that a Choice representative came to the property and took all the stamps. After spending about 50 minutes on the telephone with Choice and having them call the hotel, I was then told by the desk clerk that the manager had OK'd the use of the $50 stamps, but only toward the hotel RACK RATE, which was almost $10 higher after taxes. The desk clerk kept telling me that the manager would be in, but I did not ever see him to discuss the matter. As far as the room goes, I had problems getting into the room with the key card. I used it a couple times immediately after checking in, but later in the day, and during the next day I had problems getting in. The same desk clerk told me that it was probably due to the weather. This didn't make much sense because although it was about 35 degrees with a slight drizzle of rain, the weather is much worse during more than a few months there. So I guess this kind of problem I had with the key card must happen pretty much all winter. The desk clerk had to reissue a key card a couple times in order for it to work. The heater in the room would keep going off on me, even though I had it adjusted to a low heat CONSTANT setting. I would wake up cold and have to turn it on again. This happened six or seven times during my two day stay. The room was clean and quiet enough (I think because there were only three or four rooms occupied from the looks of the parking lot at night). The TV had cable, but they didn't even have ESPN on it, let alone ESPN2. Since I mainly watch sports on TV, this was a big negative for me. They did have three or four channels geared toward the Indian (Asian) population, and since they had a restaurant, or at least a sign for an Indian restaurant, I guess they cater to an Indian crowd. Bottom line: I spent a lot of time, and a very uncomfortable first night in this hotel because the hotel simply didn't want to follow the rules of the hotel chain. And had to pay a rate higher than what I was suppose to be guaranteed by Choice Hotels. Would never stay here again, and am intending to file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau on the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to the falls I would Rec staying on the Canada side. We had to pay $180 for a room here. There was bad service, the place was dirty and crummy looking and there was no hair dryer in the bathroom. When we got back to the motel around 10:00 at night there was no where to park and the front desk person told us we would have to park down the street for $10 dollars. Breakfast was horrible- don't waste your time!
reviews.title: A tent or a box is a better option!

reviews.text: Do not stay here!!
reviews.title: Avoid.
stay was good
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and good. we had stayed in Aug 2004 and the service was good. the rates were also reasonable and we did not have any issues with our stay.

reviews.title: If you have to stay on the U.S. side, don't stay here
reviews.text: it is 5 - 10 minute ride to Niagara falls - USA side.

reviews.title: This is the worst place I've stayed in 25 years of travel.
reviews.text: Niagara Falls is a beautiful destination, and if you are considering scheduling a visit, I enthusiastically suggest the Canadian side. It's cleaner, more attractive, offers more dramatic views of the falls and many more attractions and is generally considerably less expensive. If you choose to stay on the U.S. side, do NOT stay here. From the moment we pulled in, parking was an issue -- there simply was not enough. The lot was incredibly small -- maybe 20 car capacity at most -- and also catered to a busy Indian restaurant in the building. The clerk suggested that if we couldn't find a space, we pay $5.00 down the street at the public lot. The common spaces (elevator, stairwells, hallways) were dirty and smelled it. Our room was unbearably small (there wasn't room for all the furniture), dirty and smelled of after shave even after the window had been wide open for 2 hours. The bathroom may as well have been a public restroom, there was no tub, only a cramped stall. I can't say I've ever paid to stay in a place this poorly managed.

reviews.title: Lobby smelled antiseptic, hall carpet old, dirty, room alright.
reviews.text: Stay home rather than staying in this disgusting dump. I have travelled extensively in the U.S. and abroad for over 25 years.

reviews.title: Stay away!
reviews.text: We wanted to stay close to the Falls. I checked the tripadvisor comments on this Econolodge, but figured, "how bad can it really be?" Well, the answer is: incredibly bad.

aka: Econo Lodge At The Falls Hotel
